bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Pedro Nogueira, March 2, 1953

div1.p: Hench writes that Carbonell has been interested in the yellow fever story and helpful in a meeting with the vice-president of Cuba. Hench would like Nogueira to send a piece of Building No. 1 to Carbonell.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Pedro Nogueira, March 2, 1953
div1.opener:
March 2, 1953
Dr. Pedro Nogueira
Marti 219, Marianao
Habana, Cuba
My dear Pedro:
div1.p:
I think you have heard me say that Dr. Felipe
Carbonell of Havana has been interested in the
yellow fever story for some years and I have
had correspondence with him from time to time
about it. You may remember that one time, when
you and I were both discouraged, Doctor Carbonell
took me to meet the Vice-President and I believe
it was largely through this visit that the first
sum of money was abortively allotted.

I believe there is enough of the wood from the
caseta left over so that Doctor Carbonell might
perhaps have a piece. I would be happy if you
could send him a piece. I think he wants to pre-
sent it to the hospital where he works.

Doctor Carbonell has a private telephone which
is not listed in the telephone book but I hope
he will get in touch with you.
div1.closer:
Always sincerely, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
Copy to Dr. Carbonell
